info.game_comments:
Gilbert Collins game 2.
A poorly-worded Final Jeopardy! clue disadvantages a challenger, resulting in her being brought back later in the year.

jeopardy_round: I'M JUST NOT THAT INTO YOU

(1, 1).clue: The flow rate of water through a plumbing system is often measured in this, GPM

(2, 1).clue: In 1988 Glenn Tropf of Holy Cross set a single-season record by making 63.4% of these long shots

(3, 1).clue: Nebraska's state seal has a steamboat on this river with the Rocky Mountains in view

(5, 1).clue: You turn your nose up at this sport that gives Calder & Lady Byng trophies, so thanks, but no thanks

(6, 1).clue: Stave 1 of "A Christmas Carol" is called his "Ghost"

(1, 2).clue: Usually, it's an in-ground container used to hold wastes & allow decomposition & settling of solids

(2, 2).clue: This Tar Heel hit a championship winner vs. the Hoyas in 1982; in 2013 he was named an all-time March Madness player

(3, 2).clue: This bird feeds its young on Louisiana's seal

(4, 2).clue: A small, oval orange-yellow fruit, or its color

(5, 2).clue: I like a good glass of wine or 2; you are this type of 10-letter nondrinker

(6, 2).clue: This story mentions an apparition "said by some to be the ghost of a Hessian trooper"

(1, 3).clue: This metal alloy is used as a slang term for faucets & other fittings, regardless of the real material used to make them

(2, 3).clue: Lonzo Ball, a star for this college team, didn't have far to travel for his pro job when the Lakers took him in the 2017 draft

(3, 3).clue: This item that ends up in a bed in "The Godfather" is also on New Jersey's flag & seal

(4, 3).clue: This French word describes a fabric design that is fastened to another piece of material

(5, 3).clue: For you, it's got to be roses; I prefer this type of flower that comes in Rembrandt & Greigii varieties

(6, 3).clue: The ghosts that live in the paths of the dead in this series must never rest until they fulfill their oath made to Isildur

(2, 4).clue: In 2014 both the men's & women's teams from this university located in the small town of Storrs won basketball titles

(3, 4).clue: 8 leaves of this poi-producing plant are on Hawaii's seal

(4, 4).clue: The name of this horse may derive from the name of a river in Idaho & Washington

(5, 4).clue: I wear a suit at work; you go to the office in clothes for this activity on which Lululemon was built

(6, 4).clue: A governess is convinced that the 2 children in her care see ghosts in this novella by Henry James

(2, 5).clue: This Spokane, Wa. Jesuit school made its first appearance in the NCAA final game in 2017, but came up a tad short

(3, 5).clue: Each ray of the large star on its state seal has an emblem of one of the 5 Civilized Tribes

(4, 5).clue: It begins, "I believe in God, the Father Almighty, maker of heaven & Earth, and in Jesus Christ, His only Son"

(5, 5).clue: You like the Jason Bourne films, while I prefer classics like this one with Humphrey Bogart as a riverboat captain

(6, 5).clue: "The Haunting of" this title residence includes inexplicable noises & doors that shut by themselves

(1, 1).clue: Psychedelic mushrooms may have been used by the cult of Demeter & this abducted daughter

(2, 1).clue: This began as an attempt to buy New Orleans & might have been unconstitutional when Jefferson authorized it

(3, 1).clue: The Rhine River makes its way to this sea

(4, 1).clue: He wrote Berkshire Hathaway shareholders, "You only find out who is swimming naked when the tide goes out"

(5, 1).clue: Try not to laugh at this, the output of a currency counterfeiter

(6, 1).clue: One of the first LP records pressed in 1931 was of the Philadelphia Orchestra playing this work

(1, 2).clue: Teonanacatl, "flesh of the gods", was a mushroom sacred to these Mesoamerican people

(2, 2).clue: This 1798 law aimed at Frenchmen & Irishmen in the U.S. was passed about 3 weeks before the Sedition Act

(3, 2).clue: The 5 degrees east longitude line runs through the Netherlands & this other European country

(4, 2).clue: This comedian has 2 quotes in Bartlett's, both catchphrases: "Can we talk?" & "Who knew?"

(6, 2).clue: In the '50s the Dukes of Dixieland were one of the first to record their albums with this new dual audio process

(1, 3).clue: This circle of mushrooms is named for the magic creatures said to dance there

(2, 3).clue: The Hartford Convention was a meeting of those peeved at losing trade with Britain & opposed to this war

(3, 3).clue: This city is about 20 miles northeast of Cannes via the N98 coastal road

(4, 3).clue: In 1798 he told his men, "From the summit of yonder pyramids forty centuries look down upon you"

(5, 3).clue: If you're eager & fidgety, you might have this rhyming problem that mentions trousers

(6, 3).clue: A recent vinyl resurgence has been aided by this musician, who built a pressing plant in his Detroit hometown

(1, 4).clue: This Welsh queen of mythical creatures rules over the Ellyllon, elflike creatures that eat toadstools

(2, 4).clue: His sermon "Sinners in the Hands of an Angry God" helped fire the 18th century's Great Awakening religious movement

(3, 4).clue: This northeastern English town "Upon Tyne" gave its name to a famous brown ale

(4, 4).clue: This "wish"ful line from "Brokeback Mountain" is Annie Proulx' entry in Bartlett's
(4, 4).correct response: "I wish I knew how to quit you"

(5, 4).clue: A heroic defender, specifically of a company facing a hostile takeover

(1, 5).clue: Long before "Brave New World", this 4-letter liquid of Hindu mythology might have come from mushrooms

(2, 5).clue: After he died in 1656, Josiah Winslow succeeded him as the commander of Plymouth Colony's military forces

(3, 5).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a map on the monitor.) Lake Ladoga is connected with the Gulf of Finland and the rest of the Baltic Sea by this commercially important river that flows through St. Petersburg

(4, 5).clue: Bartlett's quotes this author: "Mother died today, or maybe it was yesterday"

(5, 5).clue: In a farm idiom a problematic situation is a "tough" one

(0, 0).clue: It's the first Oscar nominee for Best Picture to be produced by an internet streaming service
